Description: Fragment of a silver finger-ring, comprising about 30 per cent of the perimeter. In section it is circular. The surface is patinated with corrosion products.
Curator's comments: On the "many silver rings...found mostly on the surface, by the Bedawin", see W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 75
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 75) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.67, p.69, p.182, pl.24)
